item.title: How to Performance Optimize Existing Code
item.description: You’ve got some existing code and you might want to make it faster. How hard is it to make it faster?

item.title: Performance Tuning: Parse 50M DateTimes per second in C#
item.description: I love the Visual Studio C# Performance Profiler, and am shocked to find out how many engineers around me haven’t used it before.

item.title: COVID Road Trip: An Unexpected Journey
item.description: After two years of minimal travel, we decided to fly to New York City, and I promptly got COVID while there.

item.title: Search for the Ultimate Indoor Sweater
item.description: For most of my life, I’ve bought clothes on sale which seemed “good enough”. My outerwear lasts a really long time, though.

item.title: M1 MacBooks charge from anything!
item.description: I recently started using an M1 MacBook Pro 14". I wanted to know which of my cables and chargers work with it and how fast it charges from them.

item.title: FFMPEG Cheat Sheet
item.description: I’ve been using FFMPEG to transcode gaming videos often lately, and I find the reference documentation confusing. Cheat Sheet Transcode for Blog Transcode to H.

item.title: Optimizing Kingdom Rush
item.description: I love the tower defense game Kingdom Rush. More than anything else, it has just the right amount of complexity - just enough towers and abilities to give you options, and just enough tactical play to keep you busy between build steps.

item.title: Regex Builder 2.10
item.description: Today I’m releasing a new version of Regex Builder, 14 years after the previous release, thanks to an email from a fan.

item.title: Budgeting is Like Backpacking
item.description: I’ve been updating my backpacking loadout and learning from the “ultralight” backpacking community. I was struck by the parallels between backpack-packing and budgeting and how backpacking wisdom can apply to finance.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 Battery Life
item.description: My Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 battery ran out on the first day by 4:00pm, and I was pretty disappointed. After a few device resets and a lot of measurements, however, my watch is now using only about a third of the battery per full 24 hour day.

item.title: No Phone Experiment: Taking Back My Attention
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy Watch 4 recently came out, and it inspired me to try going phone-free, carrying only the watch. I spend too much time glued to my phone, and I wanted to take back my attention, but I know I need to be reachable.

item.title: Being Frugal vs Being Cheap
item.description: I used to think that “being frugal” and “being cheap” were basically the same thing. Along my saving journey, however, I found out that the two are very different.

item.title: Frugal Groceries
item.description: It’s surprising, but keeping food costs down was a big part of sticking to our budget and ultimately retiring early. Food is the third highest spending category for US households (after housing and transportation), so it’s a big part of most budgets.

item.title: Batman: Arkham Asylum
item.description: The latest in my series of game replays is Batman: Arkham Asylum, thanks to a recent GOG Sale that had it going for $5.

item.title: Our Retirement Withdrawal Plan
item.description: After you retire, you need to decide how much you can spend each year, which investments to take the money from, and when to rebalance your investments.

item.title: How Much Stock vs Bonds
item.description: How should you split your retirement investments between stock and bonds? How do you make this decision? Your chosen split is called your Asset Allocation, and you’ll often see it written as two numbers; for example, 60% stock and 40% bonds is written as “60/40”.

item.title: CloudFlare Pages Custom Domain Setup
item.description: This blog is hosted on CloudFlare Pages with CloudFlare-managed DNS, and I finally have DNS resolution working fully. The documentation was confusing and incomplete - here is what I needed to know.

item.title: How We Kept The Same Budget for Eight Years
item.description: Learning to budget and invest put us on a path to retire early, but our choice to keep the same budget for eight years (adding all of our raises to saving) enabled us to retire really early.

item.title: Getting Retirement Money Out
item.description: Once you retire, which accounts should you take your retirement spending from first? If you retire before age 59.5, how do you get IRA money out at all?

item.title: Retirement Account Types
item.description: You’re ready to start saving for retirement, but there are several different accounts you could use. Brokerage accounts, IRAs, Roth IRAs, 401(k)s.

item.title: How Long Until You Can Retire?
item.description: In “How Much You Need To Retire”, you learned that you need to save about 25 times your retirement spending to retire.

item.title: How Much You Need to Retire
item.description: So, you’ve decided to start saving for retirement. How much money will you need to save up? TL;DR: You need about 25 times your retirement spending invested in a 50% stock / 50% bonds portfolio for a 30 year retirement.

item.title: Photo Optimization
item.description: I recently decided to make a local and second-cloud backup of our digital photos, and decided to see if I could optimize them in the process.

item.title: How to Invest
item.description: You’ve made a budget, done some initial saving, and now you finally have some savings to invest for retirement. What should you invest in, and how do you go about that?

item.title: Five mistakes we made during our first Early Retirement
item.description: We retired early (the first time) in 2014 at age 33. Within two years, we were both back at work. After knowing what went wrong, we made adjustments, and I’m happy to say that we retired again in 2020 and it’s been going much better.

item.title: Quest for Glory I
item.description: Quest for Glory 1 is one of my favorite role-playing games, and one of the first I played. Sierra walked the line between adventure and puzzle games beautifully in the series, making something that still feels unique.

item.title: What To Save For
item.description: So you’ve made a budget and now you’re starting to save. What should you do with the money? Credit Card debt Emergency Fund (one month of expenses) Other Non-Mortgage Debt (car loan, student loans) Some Retirement Saving (get employer match) Future Big Purchases (house, trip, car, kid college) More Retirement Saving Audacious Goals: House Payoff, Early Retirement, Year off from Work, … First, if you have any credit card debt, pay it off.

item.title: Frugal Tip: Starbucks Cold Brew Refills
item.description: I’ve been a fan of the Starbucks Vanilla Sweet Cream cold brew since it came out and a lover of cold brew coffee since the days before Seattle’s Best Coffee disappeared.

item.title: The American Rescue Plan, ACA, and Roth conversions
item.description: The American Rescue Plan became law on March 11th, 2021, and I was surprised to figure out that it changes the taxable income we want to aim for in 2021 and 2022 significantly.

item.title: How We Budget
item.description: When we got our first real jobs, we put our paychecks into our checking account and bought everything from there. It couldn’t be easier, and I’m sure many people do the same thing.

item.title: DOSBox Cheat Sheet
item.description: Some quick tables about DOSBox that I kept looking for. Sound Card Defaults Sound - DOSBoxWiki SoundBlaster 16 Base Address: 220h IRQ: 7 DMA: 1 HDMA: 5

item.title: Win95 on DOSBox
item.description: I needed Windows to run SimTower, so I decided to try getting Win95 to run on DOSBox. The walkthroughs online had some skippable steps and I ran into some problems, and then I got distracted optimizing it.

item.title: GitHub Pages and Domain.com DNS
item.description: After some (mis)adventures, I finally got my custom domain name directed to my GitHub Pages site successfully. Here is what worked, in case someone else has the same problem.

item.title: SimTower Max Tower
item.description: A few days after my previous SimTower adventure, I wanted to revise my tower design. My retail-heavy-attempt was straightforward and didn’t take too many floors, but I thought it’d be fun to try to build consistently all the way up to the 100th floor cathedral, and to try to max out many of the in-game limits right when I reached it.

item.title: SimTower Reference
item.description: When playing through SimTower again, I was frequently looking for facts from the help and from online walkthroughs. Here’s a double-checked, complete set of the details I was looking for when replaying the game, with more useful details together in one place than the original help.

item.title: Return to SimTower
item.description: It’s 1994, and Maxis is a big name in gaming. The excellent SimCity 2000 released last year, but we’re looking at a lesser known title, SimTower.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Scott Louvau. I live near Seattle. I worked at Microsoft, mostly on Visual Studio and Visual Studio Online. I’m passionate about performance and I love to optimize things - code, games, finances, coffee - everything.

item.title: How To Retire Early
item.description: My wife and I retired just before turning 40, and here are the nuts and bolts of how we did it.

item.title: Kingdom Rush Automation
item.description: I love Kingdom Rush, so I built a syntax for transcribing games, an animator to efficiently show a game plan, and an AI Scanner to transcribe my games from video recordings.

item.title: Kingdom Rush Help
item.description: Kingdom Rush Syntax Kingdom Rush syntax is used to write a plan for how to play a given level, the same way that Chess Algebra is used to document chess games.

item.title: Pacifica Camping Build
item.description: We wanted to be able to sleep in our Pacifica, and for it to be more comfortable and faster to get to bed and get going than a random motel.

item.title: Pacifica Climate Control Circuit
item.description: We wanted to camp overnight in our 2018 Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid. If the van is plugged in or the battery is charged enough, the climate system can run overnight without the engine turning on.
